storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my daily schedule to plan my workday effectively

testCases.title: Validate daily schedule display with valid employee login
preconditions: Employee has valid login credentials
Employee has at least one shift assigned for current day and next day
Web portal is accessible and operational
Database contains employee schedule data
Network connection is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the web portal login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials (username and password)
steps.expectedResult: Credentials are accepted without validation errors

steps.action: Click the Login button
steps.expectedResult: Login successful and employee dashboard is displayed within 3 seconds

steps.action: Navigate to the daily schedule page from the dashboard menu
steps.expectedResult: Daily schedule page loads and displays the current date as the header

steps.action: Verify the daily schedule content for current day
steps.expectedResult: Schedule displays correct shift start time, end time, location, and role for the logged-in employee

steps.action: Verify the current day is highlighted in the calendar
steps.expectedResult: Current day is visually highlighted or marked distinctly from other days

steps.action: Click the 'Next Day' navigation button or arrow
steps.expectedResult: Schedule updates to show next day's shifts without page reload, transition is smooth

steps.action: Verify the schedule data for next day
steps.expectedResult: Next day's schedule displays with correct shift details and date header updates accordingly

steps.action: Verify page load time
steps.expectedResult: Schedule data loads within 3 seconds for each navigation action

postconditions: Employee remains logged in
Daily schedule page is displayed with next day's data
No errors are logged in the system
Session remains active

testCases.title: Verify access restriction to schedules of other employees
preconditions: Employee is logged into the web portal with valid credentials
Employee knows or can construct URL pattern for schedule access
Another employee's ID exists in the system
OAuth 2.0 authentication is properly configured
Role-based access control is enabled

steps.action: Log into the web portal with valid employee credentials
steps.expectedResult: Login successful and dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to own daily schedule page and note the URL structure
steps.expectedResult: Daily schedule page loads with URL containing employee ID parameter

steps.action: Manually modify the URL to include another employee's ID (e.g., change employeeId parameter)
steps.expectedResult: URL is modified in the browser address bar

steps.action: Press Enter to attempt accessing the modified URL
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied and an appropriate error message is displayed (e.g., 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to view this schedule' or HTTP 403 Forbidden)

steps.action: Verify that no schedule data from the other employee is visible
steps.expectedResult: No shift details, times, or locations from another employee's schedule are displayed

steps.action: Navigate back to own schedule using the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Own daily schedule page loads successfully

steps.action: Verify own schedule displays correctly
steps.expectedResult: Schedule shows correct shift details for the logged-in employee with accurate times and locations

postconditions: Employee can only access their own schedule
Security logs record the unauthorized access attempt
Employee session remains active and valid
No data breach has occurred

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to navigate between different schedule views to choose the most useful format

Employee has assigned shifts in the schedule
Application is accessible and running
Browser supports required features (JavaScript enabled)
Employee is not currently logged in

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials and click Login button
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard or schedule page

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule page if not already there
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads with default view (daily, weekly, or monthly) and navigation controls are visible

steps.action: Note the current schedule view format displayed
steps.expectedResult: Current view format is clearly identifiable (daily, weekly, or monthly)

steps.action: Click on the weekly view navigation control button
steps.expectedResult: Schedule updates dynamically to weekly format showing 7 days in a grid or list layout without full page reload within 3 seconds

steps.action: Verify that all shifts for the week are displayed with proper formatting

steps.expectedResult: Employee is logged out successfully and redirected to login page or public landing page

steps.action: Enter the same employee credentials and click Login button
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the schedule page

steps.action: Observe the default schedule view displayed upon login
steps.expectedResult: Weekly view is automatically restored as the default view, showing the same format as previously selected

steps.action: Verify that the weekly view navigation control appears selected or highlighted
steps.expectedResult: Weekly view button/control shows active state indicating it is the current view

postconditions: Employee remains logged in with weekly view active
View preference is persisted in user session/profile
Schedule data is displayed correctly in weekly format
No errors are logged in browser console or application logs

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view shift details including location and role to understand my assignments fully

testCases.title: Validate display of shift details on hover or selection
preconditions: Employee account exists with valid credentials
Employee has at least one assigned shift with complete details (location, role, start time, end time)
Employee is logged into the application
Schedule page is accessible and displays shifts
Browser supports hover interactions or touch events for mobile

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads successfully displaying employee's assigned shifts in the current view (daily, weekly, or monthly)

steps.action: Identify a shift displayed in the schedule view
steps.expectedResult: At least one shift is visible with basic information (date and time)

steps.action: Hover the mouse cursor over the identified shift (on desktop) or tap and hold on mobile
steps.expectedResult: Shift details tooltip or popup appears within 2 seconds displaying complete information including shift start time, end time, location, and role

steps.action: Verify that all required shift details are present in the displayed information
steps.expectedResult: Tooltip/popup shows: Shift start time, Shift end time, Location name/address, Role/position title, and information is clearly formatted and readable

steps.action: Move the mouse cursor away from the shift (or release touch on mobile)
steps.expectedResult: Tooltip or popup disappears, returning to normal schedule view

steps.action: Click or tap directly on the same shift
steps.expectedResult: Detailed shift information is displayed in an expanded view, modal, or side panel showing all shift details clearly

steps.action: Verify the detailed shift information display includes all required fields
steps.expectedResult: Detailed view shows: Shift start time, Shift end time, Location (full address or name), Role/position, and any additional relevant information formatted in a clear, readable layout

steps.action: Verify that the shift details loaded within the performance requirement
steps.expectedResult: Shift details appeared within 2 seconds of the hover or selection action

steps.action: Close the detailed shift information view (click close button, click outside modal, or press ESC key)
steps.expectedResult: Detailed view closes and schedule returns to normal display state

steps.action: Test the same interaction with a different shift in the schedule
steps.expectedResult: Hover and selection interactions work consistently, displaying correct details for the selected shift within 2 seconds

postconditions: Employee remains logged in
Schedule view returns to normal state
No shift details remain displayed
All shift information was displayed accurately
No errors are present in browser console

testCases.title: Verify access control for shift details
preconditions: API endpoint GET /api/schedules/details?shiftId={id} exists and is protected
At least one valid shift ID exists in the system
Testing tool (Postman, curl, or browser developer tools) is available
No user is currently authenticated in the testing session

steps.action: Open API testing tool (Postman, curl, or browser developer tools)
steps.expectedResult: Testing tool is ready to make HTTP requests

steps.action: Obtain a valid shift ID from the system (from database or previous authenticated request)
steps.expectedResult: Valid shift ID is available for testing (e.g., shiftId=12345)

steps.action: Construct a GET request to /api/schedules/details?shiftId={validShiftId} without including any authentication token or session cookie
steps.expectedResult: Request is properly formatted with the correct endpoint and shift ID parameter

steps.action: Send the unauthenticated GET request to the shift details API endpoint
steps.expectedResult: API responds with HTTP status code 401 (Unauthorized) or 403 (Forbidden)

steps.action: Verify the error response body contains appropriate error message
steps.expectedResult: Response body includes error message such as 'Authentication required', 'Unauthorized access', or 'Access denied' in JSON format

steps.action: Verify that no shift details data is included in the error response
steps.expectedResult: Response does not contain any sensitive shift information (location, role, times, employee data)

steps.action: Attempt to access the shift details API with an invalid or expired authentication token
steps.expectedResult: API responds with HTTP status code 401 (Unauthorized) or 403 (Forbidden) with appropriate error message

steps.action: Verify that the API does not expose shift details through error messages or headers
steps.expectedResult: No shift information is leaked through error messages, headers, or response metadata

steps.action: Log the security test results including response codes and messages
steps.expectedResult: All unauthenticated and unauthorized access attempts were properly rejected with appropriate error codes

postconditions: API endpoint remains secure and protected
No shift details were exposed to unauthenticated requests
Appropriate error responses were returned
Security logs may contain failed access attempts (if logging is implemented)

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to receive confirmation when my schedule is successfully loaded to ensure data accuracy

testCases.title: Validate confirmation message on schedule load
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has an active schedule assigned
Network connectivity is stable
Browser is supported and up to date

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule view page by clicking on 'My Schedule' or equivalent menu option
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view page begins loading

steps.action: Wait for the schedule data to load completely
steps.expectedResult: Schedule data is displayed on the screen and a clear confirmation message appears (e.g., 'Schedule loaded successfully' or success icon with message)

steps.action: Verify the confirmation message is visible and does not obstruct schedule content or navigation elements
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation message is clearly visible, positioned appropriately (e.g., top of page or corner), and does not block any schedule information or navigation buttons

steps.action: Wait for 5 seconds without any user interaction
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation message automatically disappears after exactly 5 seconds

steps.action: Verify schedule content remains fully visible and accessible after message disappears
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view is fully functional and all content is accessible without any visual artifacts from the disappeared message

postconditions: Schedule view is fully loaded and displayed
Confirmation message has disappeared
Employee can interact with schedule normally
No error messages are present

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to report issues with my schedule view to get timely support

testCases.title: Validate successful issue report submission
preconditions: Employee is authenticated and logged into the system
Employee is on the schedule page
Support ticketing system is operational
Network connectivity is available
'Report Issue' button is visible on the schedule page

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Report Issue' button on the schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Issue report form opens and is displayed with all required fields visible (e.g., Issue Description, Category, Priority) and optional fields (e.g., Screenshot upload)

steps.action: Verify all form fields are present including required field indicators (asterisks or labels)
steps.expectedResult: Form displays clearly marked required fields and optional fields, with appropriate input types (text area, dropdowns, file upload)

steps.action: Fill in all required fields with valid test data (e.g., Issue Description: 'Schedule not displaying correct shift times')
steps.expectedResult: All required fields accept input without errors, text is visible and properly formatted

steps.action: Optionally attach a screenshot file (PNG or JPG format, under size limit)
steps.expectedResult: Screenshot uploads successfully, file name is displayed, and no error messages appear

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' button on the issue report form
steps.expectedResult: Form is submitted, loading indicator appears briefly, and a confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Your issue has been reported successfully. Ticket ID: #12345')

steps.action: Verify the confirmation message includes relevant details such as ticket ID or reference number
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation message contains ticket ID, timestamp, and acknowledgment that support team has been notified

steps.action: Close the confirmation message or form
steps.expectedResult: User is returned to the schedule page, form is closed, and schedule view remains functional

postconditions: Issue report is successfully submitted to support system
Employee receives confirmation with ticket ID
Report is logged with employee ID and timestamp in the system
Support team receives notification of the new issue
Employee is returned to schedule page

testCases.title: Verify form validation for missing required fields
preconditions: Employee is authenticated and logged into the system
Employee is on the schedule page
'Report Issue' button is accessible
Issue report form can be opened

steps.action: Click the 'Report Issue' button on the schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Issue report form opens and displays with all required and optional fields

steps.action: Leave all required fields empty (do not enter any data in fields marked as required)
steps.expectedResult: Required fields remain empty and show no validation errors yet

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' button without filling any required fields
steps.expectedResult: Form submission is blocked and validation error messages are displayed next to each empty required field (e.g., 'Issue Description is required', 'Category is required')

steps.action: Verify that validation error messages are clearly visible and indicate which fields need to be completed
steps.expectedResult: Error messages are displayed in red or highlighted color, positioned near the respective fields, and provide clear guidance on what is required

steps.action: Verify that the form remains open and no data is submitted to the support system
steps.expectedResult: Form stays open with all fields still editable, no confirmation message appears, and no ticket is created in the support system

steps.action: Fill in only one required field and attempt to submit again
steps.expectedResult: Submission is still blocked, validation errors are displayed only for the remaining empty required fields, and the filled field shows no error

steps.action: Fill in all remaining required fields with valid data and submit the form
steps.expectedResult: Form validates successfully, submission proceeds, and confirmation message is displayed

postconditions: Form validation prevents submission of incomplete reports
Clear error messages guide employee to complete required fields
No invalid or incomplete reports are sent to support system
Employee can successfully submit after correcting validation errors
